rules: Rule1: If van_01 experiences a vehicle breakdown, then the morning route is not delayed
Rule2: Either van_01 experiences a vehicle breakdown or the main highway has a traffic closure
Rule3: If the main highway has a traffic closure, then the morning route is not delayed
Rule4: If driver John is assigned to the downtown route, then the downtown route uses van_02
Rule5: Either driver John is assigned to the downtown route or driver Mary is assigned to the downtown route
Rule6: Should driver Mary be assigned to the downtown route, then all routes are on schedule
Rule7: When the downtown route uses van_02, then the downtown route requires a special permit
Rule8: Given that the downtown route requires a special permit, then all routes are on schedule
Rule9: If medical supplies have an urgent delivery requirement, then medical supplies require express shipping
Rule10: When medical supplies require express shipping, then medical supplies are marked as priority
Rule11: If medical supplies are marked as priority, then medical supplies use an express courier
Rule12: Should the main depot have van_01 as an operational vehicle, then the main depot has van_02 as a backup vehicle
Rule13: If the dispatch system is operational, then all routes are on schedule
Rule14: Provided that the dispatch system undergoes a system update, then the dispatch system is operational
Rule15: Either the dispatch system undergoes a system update or the dispatch system undergoes system maintenance
Rule16: If the dispatch system undergoes system maintenance, then the dispatch system is operational
Rule17: When driver John logged 40 hours, then van_01 passes inspection
Rule18: If supervisor approved driver John's timesheet, then payroll processed driver John's timesheet
Rule19: When payroll processed driver John's timesheet, then if driver John submitted his timesheet, driver John logged 40 hours
Rule20: If driver John is eligible for overtime, then the main depot has van_02 as a backup vehicle

Rule21: If the supervisor reported an incident concerning the medical supplies, then if it is not the case that medical supplies requiring express shipping leads to medical supplies using an express courier, then an investigation is launched regarding the medical supplies
Rule22: Either the supervisor reported an incident concerning the medical supplies or the client hospital filed a customer complaint about the medical supplies

Rule23: Should the client hospital file a customer complaint about the medical supplies, then if it is not the case that medical supplies requiring express shipping results in medical supplies using an express courier, then an investigation is launched regarding the medical supplies
Rule24: Either the medical supplies delivery is delayed or medical supplies do not have an urgent delivery requirement
Rule25: Provided that the operations manager gives approval for the medical supplies, then if the medical supplies receive expedited processing, the medical supplies delivery is not delayed
Rule26: Either the operations manager gives approval for the medical supplies or the automated priority system handles the medical supplies
Rule27: If the automated priority system handles the medical supplies, then when the medical supplies receive expedited processing, the medical supplies delivery is not delayed
Rule28: When van_01 passes inspection, then if van_01 requires vehicle inspection, then if all routes are not on schedule, the main depot has van_01 as an operational vehicle
Rule29: If van_01 is scheduled for inspection, then either van_01 fails inspection or van_01 passes inspection

Rule30: If it is not the case that medical supplies requiring express shipping results in medical supplies using an express courier, then an investigation is not launched regarding the medical supplies

Rule31: Provided that it is not the case that driver John completing safety training leads to driver John having valid insurance resulting in all routes being on schedule, then the morning route is delayed
Rule32: If it is not the case that van_01 not passing inspection leads to driver John not requiring retraining, then driver John is suspended from duty
Rule33: Should it not be the case that all routes not being on schedule leads to driver John being eligible for overtime, then driver John is denied overtime
Rule34: If van_01 does not pass inspection, then driver John requires retraining
Rule35: When all routes are not on schedule, then medical supplies have an urgent delivery requirement
Rule36: If all routes are not on schedule, then the main depot does not have van_02 as a backup vehicle
facts: Fact1: Driver John submitted his timesheet
Fact2: Supervisor approved driver John's timesheet
Fact4: The medical supplies receive expedited processing
Fact5: Van_01 is scheduled for inspection
Fact6: Driver John has valid insurance
Fact7: Driver John completed safety training
Fact8: Medical supplies do not use an express courier
Fact9: Driver John is not suspended from duty
Fact10: Driver John is not denied overtime
Fact11: Van_01 does not fail inspection
